column18: 04/01/2002: Suspected members of the Angolan rebel group National Union for the Total Independence of Angola (UNITA) abducted three Zambians from the town of Sikongo in Zambia. Approximately 15 rebels attacked the villagers, and raped one of the abducted women before kidnapping them. They are believed to have been held in Angola. They have not been released, and the reasons for the abduction are unknown.

column18: 02/28/1999: A bomb exploded at the Angolan Embassy in Lusaka, Zambia, killing a security guard and wounding another. Authorities suspected that the National Union for the Total Independence of Angola (UNITA) was responsible for this attack. In addition to this bombing, four other areas were also attacked on this day.
column58: National Union for the Total Independence of Angola (UNITA)
column64: Possibly to destabilize relations between Angola and Zambia.
